result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by court reporter, Cheryl Humpal - From Motion Hearing Held on 07/26/17.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 02/05/16 plea/sentencing.

Defendant Akida G Berry in court with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Counts #1 & 3 in Case #13CF499.   NOTE:  Cash bail posted on this file is to be returned to person who posted it.
Hearing on February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Akida G. Berry in court with attorney Nicole M. Masnica.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Both parties request a jury trial date on other case. Court sets other case for jury status and jury trial. Case set with 14CF499.  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on November 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 14, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Akida G Berry in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.   Bail remains as fixed.
  Hearing scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Nicole M Masnica in court.   Defendant Akida G Berry did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Masnica states defendant will not be appearing.    Court issues but stays the capias until the next court date.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

$2500.00 CASH BAIL FROM 13CF499 TO BE APPLIED TO THIS CASE. DEFENDANT SHALL RETURN THE MOTORCYCLE TO VICTIM/BUSINESS LISTED IN CRIMINAL COMPLAINT BY JUNE 13, 2014 BY 5:00 P.M. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN AS SET AS FOLLOWS:
Defendant to have no contact with alleged victim/witness/business or employess at the business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Akida G Berry in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for bail review. Attorney Masnica advised court that there is an agreement with the State for modification of bail. State is in agreement. Court modifies bail. 
  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Akida G Berry in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith Jr. for Atty. Nicole M Masnica.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Masnica requests an adjournment for request for bail review. Court grants adjournment.    Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Akida G Berry in court, in custody, with attorney law intern for Atty. Nicole M Masnica.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
